tool.name: Compute signature scores

param.name: genes
param.label: Comma-separated list of genes to include in signature
param.help: Comma-separated list of genes to include in signature, eg "ZNF454,GAPDH,LAIR1,ACAD9,CHTOP"

param.name: threshold
param.label: Threshold to keep a proposed gene in the effective signature
param.help: signature gene that are not expressed in at least this percentage of cells will not be kept to compute the effective signature

tool.help:
**What it does**
The tools takes a table of _normalized_ gene expression values (rows) in single cell RNAseq library sequencing (columns) and a comma-separated list of genes, and returns in a table the geometric mean of expression of these genes for each cell/library. This geometric mean is considered as the score for the genes signature for a given cell/library.
**Inputs**
A table of comma (csv) or tabulation (tsv) separated values. Gene names should be in the first column and cell names should be in the first row. Note that in a number of a csv files, header of the gene column is omitted, resulting in a first row with one item less than in other rows. This is handled by the tool that recognises this situation.
A comma separated list of genes desired as contributing to the signature score of the cell/library
The expression threshold for signature genes (the aforementioned gene list) to be effectively taken into account to compute signature scores. By default, genes are taken into account if they are expressed in at least 20% of cells/libraries
** Outputs ** The tools returns a table "signature scores" that contains
* the cell/library identifier * the signature score for this identifier * the rate of the signature score, ie whether it is higher (HIGH) or lower (LOW) that the average signature score in all cells/libraries * the number of genes detected in the cell/library * the total number of aligned reads in the cell/library
And also several tables or PDF :
* signature genes covariance matrix * signature genes correlation matrix * genes statistics (mean expression, standard deviation, variance, percentage of detection) * a pdf with the violin plot of signature score for each transcriptomes splitted by their category (HIGH/LOW)
